text:
Harlem River Bridge: The Park Ave. Bridge of the New York Central Railroad spanning the Harlem River from the northern extremity of Park Ave., at East 134th Street. The photographer is viewing northward from the Third Ave. Bridge.

July 3, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
(not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - [Harlem River Bridge - Park Avenue Bridge of the New York Central Railroad.]

text:
Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: The Pathe Talking Picture Studio fire that wrecked the building at the S. W. corner of Park Avenue and E. 134th Street. Ten people were killed and twenty-seven injured. This disaster was one of the scandals of the year.

December 10, 1929

Ewing Galloway
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in the Pathe Talking Picture Studio.]

text:

text:
The New York Edison Company plant, 134th Street at Park Ave., seen from the Riker's Island Ferry.
September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

1988-1994 Park Avenue, at the S.W. corner of East 134th Street. Also shown at the extrem right, is a portion of a 4-story warehouse, at the N.W. corner of E. 134th Street.

December 16, 1936

P. L. Sperr

Park Ave. Bridge of the New York Central Railroad, across the Harlem River, looking towards the Bronx from Manhattan. The Manhattan approach to the Bridge is East 134th Street. This is a set of 3 views.

December 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
(not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Harlem River Bridges - Park Avenue Bridge - New York Central Railroad Bridge.

text:
Park Ave., west side, south from East 134th Street, showing two clearances; one between 134th and 133rd Streets and the other incorporating the entire block front from 133rd to 132nd Streets. Across the latter and over the roof tops of buildings fronting on East 132nd Street is the spire of All Saints Roman Catholic Church. On the extreme left appears the elevated tracks of the New York Central Railroad curving southward to continue on Park Ave. after crossing the Harlem River from the Bronx.

April 16, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 134th Steet (East)
